newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Daewoo to develop Vietnam bauxite mine.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo to develop Vietnam bauxite mine.

text.p: South Korea's Daewoo Corp has signed a letter of intent with Vietnam Minerals Corp (VIMICO) to develop a bauxite mine in Daklak province and build an alumina refinery, a company spokesman said on Tuesday.
The total project cost would be about $1.0 billion and the expected annual alumina production would reach about one million tonnes, he said.
The spokesman said the company planned to start a feasibility study in September with the Korea Resources Corp.
If the feasibility study is positive, Daewoo would set up a joint venture with VIMICO to develop the mine and build the refinery by 2000, the spokesman said.
Daewoo also plans to build an aluminium smelter in Vietnam if the company gets infrastructure support from the Vietnam government, he added.
